definition: to be a different person/not to be one's usual self
to judge/to sentence/to discriminate/to discern/obviously (different)
to seem/like/as/if
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: Well, I must say, you are looking quite a different person.
sentences.chinese: 喂，我得说，你现在完整判若两人。

sentences.english: The new husband didn't appear to be he person that he was when I had money.
sentences.chinese: 新婚丈夫与我有钱的时候相比判若两人。

definition: former days/the past
to be precisely the same/to be no different
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
way of doing sth/behavior/to act in an affected manner/mannerism/gestures in opera
remarkably alike
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: overbearing/arrogant bully
not at all the same/substantially different
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
as cold as ice and frost (idiom, usually of woman); icy manner/frigid
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
entirely different/different as black and white
see 做派[zuo4 pai4]
appearance/manner/bearing/deportment/look/expression/mien
high-spirited/full of mettle
